p: Some VOCS have been exclusively described in Citrus aurantium, principally monoterpene compounds, hydrocarbons such as α-ocimene ( Baik et al., 2008) and oxygenated compounds such as α-terpinen-4-ol acetate ( Pino and Rosado, 2000). The set of species most different to C. aurantium include C. junos, C. bergamia, C. medica, C. aurantifolia and especially C. limon, although some of them have several compounds in common with C. aurantium and some species in other clusters. This is the case of thymol, reported in C. aurantium, C. reticulata, C. sinensis, C. aurantifolia, C. medica, C. junos and C. limon ( Supplementary Table S2) ( Miyazawa et al., 2009; Dugo and Mondello, 2011; Aliberti et al., 2016; Zhang et al., 2017).
